business.headline: Tenneco Clean Air Share Price: Stock makes strong debut at 27% premiumTenneco Clean Air shares listed at Rs 505 on the NSE and Rs 498 on the BSE, compared with its issue price of Rs 397.

Groww shares slump 6% after massive post-listing rally. Why is it falling today?After four straight sessions of runaway gains, the stock finally cooled off on Wednesday, slipping more than 6% in early trade. At around 9:50 am, shares of the company were down 6.10% to Rs 177.25 on the NSE.
Waaree Energies share price falls over 5%. Why is it down today?The stock slipped 4.26% to Rs 3,143.20 on the BSE in the opening minutes and later extended losses to trade 5.6% lower at Rs 3,089.
Sensex, Nifty trade flat; analysts urge investors to stay defensiveThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 81.17 points to 84,591.85 at 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 32.40 points to 25,877.65.

Gold, silver prices drop: Will the fall continue? What investors should knowGold, silver price: The focus now is on the minutes from the Fed's latest policy meeting and key US jobs data, both of which may influence gold and silver prices in the coming days.

Tenneco Clean Air IPO listing: Strong debut or slow start? What GMP suggestsTenneco Clean Air offered 6,34,76,070 shares, but investors placed bids for 3,92,21,37,714 shares, amounting to Rs 1,55,708.87 crore, showing strong interest in the company.

Credit card EMIs: Smart tool or hidden cost?Credit card EMIs have become a common way to manage big purchases, but are they truly a smart budgeting tool or just another expense disguised as convenience?

Good news on India–US trade deal once it's fair and equitable, says Piyush GoyalSpeaking at the Indo-US Economic Summit organised by the Indo-American Chamber of Commerce in New Delhi, Piyush Goyal said negotiations are moving ahead, but a final announcement will come only when the terms are acceptable and mutually beneficial.

What is the 9-9-6 work culture Narayana Murthy wants Indians to learn from?In his latest remarks, Murthy referred to China's well-known 9-9-6 working culture, a system followed by many Chinese tech companies during their rapid growth phase.

What your health insurer's high claim settlement ratio isn't telling youHealth insurance claim settlement ratios often look impressive but hide critical details about payouts, delays, and deductions. In this special report, we unpack what the number really means for policyholders.
Sensex ends 325 points lower, Nifty closes below 26,000; IT stocks fallThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 324.96 points to close at 84,625.99, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 103.40 points to end at 25,910.05.
Fujiyama Power Systems IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusApplicants can now check whether they have received shares through the BSE website or the registrar, MUFG Intime India Pvt Ltd.

Rs 5,000 SIP vs Rs 60,000 lump sum: Which creates more wealth in 10 years?Is it wiser to invest Rs 5,000 every month, or does a yearly Rs 60,000 lump sum genuinely create more wealth in the long run? We explore the answer here.
Excelsoft Technologies IPO Opens on November 19: Check GMP and price bandFounded in 2000, Excelsoft Technologies is known for its tech-led solutions in the education and assessment industry.

Why chasing every new IPO can hurt your portfolioChasing every new IPO may feel exciting, but it often does more harm than good. Many recent listings have slipped below their issue price, showing that hype doesn't always translate into real returns.

PhysicsWallah shares up 40% over IPO price: Should you sell or hold?The stock opened at Rs 145 on the NSE and Rs 143.10 on the BSE, giving investors a 33% premium over the issue price of Rs 109. This opening surprised market participants, as the GMP trend had pointed to only a mild gain ahead of the listing.

Has your tax refund been delayed? CBDT chief explains whyIf you're still waiting for your income-tax refund, you're not alone. The CBDT chief has clarified why some payouts are taking longer this year and what the department is doing to speed things up.

Digital gold firms knock on Sebi's door, seek regulatory supervision: ReportWith digital gold gaining traction across India, questions around safety and regulation are becoming louder. Industry bodies and platforms now want formal oversight to boost trust in the fast-growing segment.

PhysicsWallah makes strong market debut as shares list at 33% premiumPhysicsWallah share price: The stock listed at Rs 145 on the NSE and Rs 143.10 on the BSE, marking a sharp 33% premium over its issue price of Rs 109.

Narayana Murthy now cites Chinese 9-9-6 system to back 72-hour work week callIn a recent interview, the 79-year-old billionaire referred to China's well-known 9-9-6 work culture to support his long-held view that young Indians should work longer hours to help India grow faster.

entertainment.headline: After HYBE, G-Dragon's agency plans India entry with new subsidiary: Reports Korean entertainment giants are sharpening their India focus, eyeing a booming fan economy. Galaxy Corp's planned entry signals the next big wave of K-pop expansion into the country.

Bigg Boss 19: Farhana's mother calls herself Gaurav's superfan, outsmarts Amaal Farrhana Bhatt's mother made a memorable entry in 'Bigg Boss 19' during family week. Her witty interactions with housemates like Gaurav Khanna and Amaal Mallik quickly won over housemates and fans alike, adding a fun twist to the show.

Pakistan's 'Bleed India...' strategy and Dhurandhar's explosive trailer Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' trailer combines high-octane action with a gripping take on the "thousand cuts" strategy, tracing its roots to Pakistan's political history while building a fictional, espionage-driven narrative.

Rashmika Mandanna credits partner for emotional healing amid The Girlfriend success Rashmika Mandanna, in a recent interview, spoke about her current happiness and healing, crediting her partner for his support without naming Vijay Deverakonda.

Video: Zubeen Garg gets record tribute on birthday as 25,000 artistes sing Mayabini What began as a birthday celebration evolved into history, as 25,000 artistes performed Zubeen Garg's hit song 'Mayabini', immortalising the musician's bond with Bodoland.

Jennifer Aniston makes first public appearance with boyfriend Jim Curtis Jennifer Aniston and boyfriend Jim Curtis made their first official public appearance as a couple at a Los Angeles gala, marking a major step in their relationship. The outing comes shortly after Aniston called Curtis "extraordinary" in an interview and went Instagram official with him.

The Girlfriend: Rahul Ravindran on the film that made women feel seen, empowered Director Rahul Ravindran's 'The Girlfriend' turns the spotlight on the experiences of women in toxic relationships. The film challenges industry myths about female audiences and reshapes romantic storytelling in Indian cinema.

De De Pyaar De 2 box office Day 5: Ajay Devgn's rom-com sees small recovery 'De De Pyaar De 2' saw a slight improvement on Day 5 after its steep Monday drop, but the overall box office numbers remain weak. Despite a minor weekday bump, the rom-com continues to struggle due to average audience feedback and changing post-pandemic viewing trends.

SRK, Salman Khan spark nostalgia dancing to O Oh Jaane Jaana at a wedding. Watch Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan fans rejoiced after a viral video showed the two superstars dancing to 'O Oh Jaane Jaana' during what appears to be a wedding celebration.

Vignesh Shivan gifts Nayanthara Rs 10 crore Rolls-Royce for her birthday. See pics Director Vignesh Shivan marked actor Nayanthara's birthday by gifting her a Rolls-Royce Black Badge Spectre, sharing images of the luxury car on social media.

Varanasi: Title dispute erupts over Rajamouli-Mahesh Babu-Priyanka Chopra film A dispute over the title rights of the upcoming film 'Varanasi' has emerged after it was learnt that it lies with CH Subba Reddy of Rama Bramha Hanuma Creations. The Rajamouli-directorial features Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra and Prithviraj Sukumaran.

Deepika Padukone opens up on regret, growth and choosing films with purpose Deepika Padukone reflected on her 18-year journey in cinema, admitting that she sometimes regrets past film choices. The actor said authenticity is now her only non-negotiable as she moves forward with a clearer sense of purpose.

Na toh karvan ki: 65-year-old qawwali gets a spin in gory Dhurandhar trailer How 'Dhurandhar' revives the classic qawwali 'Na toh karvan ki talaash hai', turning the 1960 number into the trailer's biggest surprise.

Manoj Bajpayee turns hilarious pookie father ahead of The Family Man 3 trailer Manoj Bajpayee hilariously embraces Gen Z lingo as Srikant Tiwari in a new promo for 'The Family Man' Season3, sporting a 'pookie' filter and fumbling slang with perfect comic timing.

Tom Cruise shares old photo with Alejandro G Inarritu after honorary Oscar moment Tom Cruise shared a rare throwback photo with filmmaker Alejandro G. Inarritu, taken during a rehearsal on the set of their upcoming film. The post came just after Inarritu presented Cruise with the Academy Honorary Award, making the moment even more special.

Ira Levin's The Boys From Brazil returns as limited series with A-list cast Netflix is reviving Ira Levin's 'The Boys From Brazil' as a five-episode limited series from Peter Morgan, led by Jeremy Strong, Gillian Anderson, Daniel Brühl and Lizzy Caplan. The historical thriller follows a Nazi hunter racing to stop a deadly plot that could resurrect a Fourth Reich.

Black Doves Season 2: Keira Knightley leads returning cast with major new additions 'Black Doves' season two has officially begun production with Keira Knightley, Ben Whishaw and Sarah Lancashire returning alongside a powerful new ensemble cast. The upcoming season raises the stakes as Helen navigates deeper political danger, fractured loyalties and high-tension spy intrigue.

Andhra King Taluka trailer: Ram Pothineni leads an emotional fan-idol saga The much-anticipated trailer of 'Andhra King Taluka', starring Ram Pothineni, Bhagyashri Borse, and Upendra, was launched at a public event in Kurnool. The film will hit theatres on November 27.

Jaya Bachchan, Waheeda Rehman attend Kamini Kaushal's prayer meet The film community gathered to pay respects to Kamini Kaushal during a peaceful prayer meet. It was attended by Jaya Bachchan and Waheeda Rehman, among others.

general news.headline: Nitish Kumar to resign today, clear decks for 10th term as Bihar Chief Minister Live UpdatesBihar New Government Formation: Nitish Kumar will submit his resignation to Governor Arif Mohammad Khan along with letters of support from all NDA partners, clearing the path for his swearing-in as Bihar Chief Minister for a record 10th term.

Seven Maoists killed in Andhra Pradesh encounter day after Madvi Hidma eliminatedSeven Maoists were killed in a fresh encounter at Maredumilli in Andhra Pradesh. Police said three women were among the dead and identification is underway. The operation followed intelligence from Tuesday's Hidma encounter.

8-month-pregnant Indian-origin IT analyst killed due to speeding BMW in SydneyAn eight-month-pregnant Indian-origin woman was killed in Sydney's Hornsby in a freak accident. The 33-year-old IT analyst, Samanvitha Dhareshwar, was killed by a car that was hit by a speeding BMW being driven by an Australian teen.

Gangster Anmol Bishnoi, 2 men wanted in Punjab among 200 Indians deported by USThe United States has deported 200 Indian nationals, including notorious gangster Anmol Bishnoi, back to India. This significant move marks a crucial step in India's fight against organised crime and fugitive criminals abroad.

Varanasi: Title dispute erupts over Rajamouli-Mahesh Babu-Priyanka Chopra filmA dispute over the title rights of the upcoming film 'Varanasi' has emerged after it was learnt that it lies with CH Subba Reddy of Rama Bramha Hanuma Creations. The Rajamouli-directorial features Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra and Prithviraj Sukumaran.

Showed no remorse: Lawyer of Delhi bomber's aide who owned i20 used for blastAmir Rashid Ali, accused of aiding the recent car blast near Delhi's Red Fort, owned the Hyundai i20 used in the attack and showed no remorse or guilt, his defence lawyer Smriti Chaturvedi made a dramatic revelation.

A Pakistani CM just exposed Pakistan govt's terror policyKhyber Pakhtunkhwa Chief Minister Sohail Afridi has accused Islamabad of staging terror attacks and sabotaging peace efforts in the province. The remarks of the CM from Imran Khan's party came even as the Pakistani military said it killed 38 terrorists in four separate operations in the volatile tribal province bordering Afghanistan.

No question of sacking Gautam Gambhir, India need better pitches: Sourav GangulyFormer Indian skipper Sourav Ganguly has dismissed calls to sack Gautam Gambhir after India's Eden Gardens defeat. Instead, he believes pitches, patience and clearer planning are the real priorities as India look to correct recurring Test-match flaws.

Madvi Hidma killed, how close is Maoist movement to its end?How the top commander and tactician rose through the Maoist ranks and what his elimination means in the protracted battle against the insurgents

Killed Baba Siddique at Lawrence Bishnoi's behest: Plotter Zeeshan AkhtarZeeshan Akhtar, a key accused in last year's murder of Baba Siddique, has confessed to killing the NCP leader at the request of jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi.

Pawar vs Pawar: Baramati prepares for another prestige clash in civic pollsBaramati is poised for a closely watched municipal council election on December 2, with the Pawar family rivalry between Ajit Pawar's NCP and Sharad Pawar's NCP (SP) taking centre stage.

SRK, Salman Khan spark nostalgia dancing to O Oh Jaane Jaana at a wedding. WatchShah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan fans rejoiced after a viral video showed the two superstars dancing to 'O Oh Jaane Jaana' during what appears to be a wedding celebration.

CGC University, Mohali: Where vision becomes legacy and education becomes evolutionStories of students who dare to dream, of educators who ignite curiosity, and of a community that chooses progress with purpose.

He knew nothing: Trump defends MBS, contradicts US intel on Khashoggi murderDonald Trump defended Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman amid controversy over journalist Jamal Khashoggi's murder. Mohammed bin Salman called the episode painful, saying it was really painful to watch anyone losing his life for no real purpose or not in a legal way.

Sundar Pichai warns AI bubble burst could shake all tech firms, including GoogleAs AI fever grips global markets, Google CEO Sundar Pichai warns that when the hype cools, even the biggest tech players may feel the chill.

Pakistan's 'Bleed India...' strategy and Dhurandhar's explosive trailerRanveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' trailer combines high-octane action with a gripping take on the "thousand cuts" strategy, tracing its roots to Pakistan's political history while building a fictional, espionage-driven narrative.

This is revenge, not justice: Sheikh Hasina's son Sajeeb Wazed on death verdictSajeeb Wazed accused the Muhammad Yunus-led interim administration of selective justice, claiming killings of police personnel and Awami League workers during the 2024 student uprising had been given indemnity.

Zohran Mamdani hates Indians: Trump junior's big charge against NYC Mayor-electEric Trump's assertion that Mamdani "hates the Indian population" is part of a wider Republican effort to portray the mayor-elect as a radical socialist, with critics warning that his policies could threaten the city's stability.

Nithin, Nikhil Kamath's mother takes you down memory lane with their childhood picsIn a Facebook post, Revathi Kamath shared a one-minute clip stitched together with rare throwback pictures of Nithin and Nikhil Kamath.

Vignesh Shivan gifts Nayanthara Rs 10 crore Rolls-Royce for her birthday. See picsDirector Vignesh Shivan marked actor Nayanthara's birthday by gifting her a Rolls-Royce Black Badge Spectre, sharing images of the luxury car on social media.

Photo shows Dr Shaheen, Muzammil buying Brezza seized from Al-Falah UniversityA photo has surfaced showing one of the Red Fort blast accused, Dr Shaheen, buying a Maruti Brezza, which was among the cars used for transporting explosives. This comes as the NIA probes broader plans for multiple car blasts and a major fidayeen attack.

Cold snap grips India early, drives temperatures below normalA cold spell is causing below normal temperatures across India with early winter chills in Delhi. The cold wave may intensify with rain and fog affecting several regions in the coming days.

Chinese 'headhunter' spies using LinkedIn to target British lawmakers, warns MI5The British government has rolled out a new action plan as MI5 issued the warning to MPs, Peers and Parliamentary staff after finding that Chinese intelligence officers were attempting to recruit people with access to sensitive state information.

sports.headline: Bazball was designed only for Ashes in Australia: Ponting's stunning claim Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has claimed that England's Bazball approach was crafted with a single objective: to win the Ashes in Australia. He also accused the team of being dishonest in the way they publicly speak about their aggressive style and the results it has produced.

Curacao becomes the smallest-ever nation to qualify for FIFA World Cup Curacao have become the smallest country ever to qualify for a FIFA World Cup finals after holding on for a tense 0-0 draw against Jamaica on the final day of the Concacaf qualifying campaign.

The horror of 19 November: A first-hand account of how a billion dreams shattered The morning of 19 November 2023 dawned with a sense of hope that seemed to bind the entire nation together. Billions prayed for their collective World Cup dream to finally come true. It was unlike any other day — all roads led to the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, where a sea of Indian fans gathered, hearts pounding, ready to witness history unfold. But as the hours wore on, it became clear that destiny had scripted a different ending.

Scotland beat Denmark 4-2 in thriller to reach first men's World Cup in 28 years Scotland qualified for the men's World Cup for the first time in nearly three decades after two stoppage-time goals sealed a thrilling 4-2 victory over Denmark at Hampden Park.

Barron's a big fan: Trump to Ronaldo as football star attends state dinner for MBS In an address at the state dinner on Tuesday night, Donald Trump thanked the five-time Ballon d'Or winner for attending and said that his youngest son, Barron, is a "big fan" and the 19-year-old was impressed that he got to meet the Portugal football legend.

Will desperate India bring reinforcements to counter Simon Harmer threat? India face a selection dilemma for the Guwahati Test as Shubman Gill's absence forces a rethink of their left-hand heavy batting order, pushing the team to consider in-form options like Karun Nair or Ruturaj Gaikwad to counter South Africa's spin threat.

Gambhir wasn't playing Kolkata Test: Robin Uthappa slams India coach critics India's dramatic collapse to just 93 at Eden Gardens has reignited criticism of head coach Gautam Gambhir, but former India batter Robin Uthappa believes the blame is misplaced. Uthappa insists that a coach cannot be held responsible when players fail to execute their plans on the field.

Washington Sundar not a No.3 batter, India need to rethink his spot: Sourav Ganguly IND vs SA: Sourav Ganguly questioned Washington Sundar's suitability as India's No. 3 in Tests and criticised the team's decision to play four spinners in the Kolkata match, urging a return to specialist top-order batters and a more balanced attack.

India A cruise to Asia Cup semis despite rare off day for Vaibhav Suryavanshi India A bounced back strongly after their loss to Pakistan A, easing past Oman A to reach the Asia Cup semifinals. Harsh Dubey's composed fifty and a disciplined bowling effort ensured a confident, much-needed turnaround for the squad.

India's football dream screams after embarrassing 0-1 loss to BangladeshIndia's 0–1 defeat to Bangladesh capped a tough night that summed up a wider footballing crisis. With the ISL's future uncertain and the national team bottom of their group, India's football dream feels increasingly shaky.

No question of sacking Gautam Gambhir, India need better pitches: Sourav GangulyFormer Indian skipper Sourav Ganguly has dismissed calls to sack Gautam Gambhir after India's Eden Gardens defeat. Instead, he believes pitches, patience and clearer planning are the real priorities as India look to correct recurring Test-match flaws.

India need to change their mindset after Kolkata Test loss: Sourav GangulyIND vs SA: India need a mindset shift after their Kolkata Test defeat, says Sourav Ganguly, who admits the Eden pitch "was not the greatest" and insists India must play on better surfaces despite their request for a turning track.

Nervous Pakistan survive Zimbabwe scare to make winning start in tri-seriesPAK vs ZIM: Pakistan survived a major scare to chase down 148 and beat Zimbabwe by five wickets in the opening match of the tri-series, thanks to Usman Khan's unbeaten 37 and Mohammad Nawaz's late heroics.

Kolkata loss no worry; no one questioned our wins on turning tracks: BhuvneshwarBhuvneshwar Kumar feels that India's loss in the first Test against South Africa at Eden Gardens in Kolkata is nothing to worry about. He also snapped back at the pitch critics, saying that it was never questioned when India were winning.

Back to original form: Babar Azam trolled after 0 vs Zimbabwe in Pakistan tri-seriesPAK vs ZIM: Babar Azam was dismissed for a duck in the T20 tri-series opener against Zimbabwe at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium. The dismissal sparked intense criticism and increased pressure on Pakistan's star batter.

Gavaskar quotes Ben Stokes to slam Indian pitch critics: Haranguing predictableIndia's defeat at Eden Gardens has reignited the pitch debate, but Sunil Gavaskar insists the criticism is misplaced. He says India must fix its batting approach instead of blaming turning tracks.

Bangladesh captain slammed for 'Am I Harmanpreet Kaur' remark: In your dreamsBangladesh captain Nigar Sultana Joty faced backlash after criticising Indian World Cup-winning captain Harmanpreet Kaur while denying allegations of mistreating junior players. Harmanpreet was involved in a controversy two years ago.

Harmanpreet was involved in a controversy two years ago.

MS Dhoni still on-field captain of CSK, Ruturaj just on paper: Mohammad KaifMohammad Kaif believes MS Dhoni will continue as Chennai Super Kings' central leader in IPL 2026, playing a crucial mentoring and guiding role on the field, even though Ruturaj Gaikwad is the official captain.

Saif Hassan named Bangladesh T20I vice-captain, Litton Das captain until T20 World CupSaif Hassan has been promoted to Bangladesh's T20I vice-captaincy following impressive performances this year, while Litton Das remains T20I captain ahead of the 2026 World Cup to be held next year.

India bring in ambidextrous spinner to deal with South Africa spin threat in GuwahatiIND vs SA: India roped in ambidextrous Bengal spinner Kaushik Maity for specialised match-simulation training to help their batters prepare for South Africa's potent spin attack ahead of the second Test in Guwahati.

Karim Benzema comes in support of Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr: He's phenomenalKarim Benzema has come to the defence of Vinicius Jr amid rising criticism in Spain. The former Real Madrid striker believes the Brazilian is being judged too harshly and still has the potential to reach even greater heights.

Saina Nehwal and Peter Gade reunite in Delhi to inspire badminton's next generationBadminton icons Saina Nehwal and Peter Gade will headline the Legends' Vision – Legacy Tour India as the initiative returns to Delhi after eight years. The two-day event brings legends, juniors and fans together, highlighted by a racquet donation drive aimed at widening access to the sport.

Manu Bhaker after ISSF World Championships failure: You can't win everydayManu Bhaker reflected on her medal-less World Championships campaign, praising Esha Singh's bronze while acknowledging her own dip in form and stressing that setbacks are part of sport.

Even Tendulkar or Kohli won't survive on current Indian pitches: Harbhajan SinghFormer India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has slammed Indian pitches, saying that batting stalwarts like Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli wouldn't be able to survive on such surfaces.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
